result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashton J Hartsfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations per DOC policy. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving 50% of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety. 
Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. 
Counseling deemed necessary. 
DNA sample must be provided within 30 days. 
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No contact w/victim or their residence 
AODA evaluation and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections assessment and agent.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Nolan-Plutchak brings a motion to amend bond to a $20,000 cash bond. Attorney Lambert opposes.  

Court denies the motion. Bond is continued.

records.addlTxt:
02:44 PM Defendant Ashton J Hartsfield in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashton J Hartsfield appeared by video means.  Court questions regarding non-representation.  Court will proceed with the option of having the matter reheard.  Officer Joseph Foy is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence regarding shots being fired.  Testifies to speaking with defendant.  Testifies to speaking with an individual who showed him messages from the defendant.  Testifies to his observations of the damage from the bullet strikes.  Testifies to finding ammunition in the defendant's bedroom.   Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

01:53 PM Defendant Ashton J Hartsfield not in court. Mother of the defendant appears in court and wants to speak to the judge. She explains what happened and court informs her she needs to make a complaint to the Wisconsin Police Department or Sheriff's Department, she can also retain a lawyer on that matter. Court gives her information on how the defendant can retain counsel.

01:46 PM Defendant Ashton J Hartsfield in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashton J Hartsfield appeared by video means.
Court informs the defendant on how he can get an attorney. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
Defendant requests a bond modification. Court denies. 

Bond is continued.
